snippet: Andrew M. Cuomo has said he wants to concentrate on being “the best governor I can be,” but Mario M. Cuomo has higher ambitions for him.
abstract: Mario M Cuomo, former governor of New York, muses before a crowd gathered to mark his 80th birthday, that someday his son, Andrew M Cuomo, may have the opportunity to serve as president; despite widespread discussion that Andrew Cuomo could be a strong contender for his party’s nomination in 2016, he has repeatedly sought to tamp down such talk and has chosen a particularly low-key role at this year's Democratic National Convention.
lead_paragraph: Andrew M. Cuomo has said he wants to concentrate on being “the best governor I can be,” but Mario M. Cuomo has higher ambitions for him.

headline.seo: Cuomo’s Father Speaks of Presidential Future for Son
headline.main: Cuomo for President? Who Said That? Well, Dad
headline.print_headline: Cuomo for President? Who Said That? Well, Dad
